full_text:
IN THE COURT OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS- ITI
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present: Sri. Vinod Babu M.U
Judicial Magistrate of First Class - III
Thursday the 06" day of March, 2025
CP. No.62/2024
(Thampanoor Police Station Crime 802/2024)
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police,
Thampanoor Police Station.
(By Sri. Manu Kallampally,Assistant Public
Prosecutor Grade-I)
Accused : Ligin Lal.V, S/o Lohithakshan, aged 29 years,
Lakshmipuram veedu, near Ariyakkal Valal Devi
temple, Mele Champadu village, Thalassery taluk,
Kannur district.
(By Adv. Sri. Venkodu K. Jayakumar)
Offences : Under Sections 64(1),64(2)(i)(m) and 69 of the
Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.
Order The Case is committed to the Hon'ble Sessions Court,
Thiruvananthapuram, as provided under Section
209(a) of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
Heard, perused the records and passed the following:
ORDER

1. This case has been arisen from the final report filed by the Sub Inspector of
Police, Thampanoor Police Station in Crime No. 802/2024 against the accused
alleged to have committed the offences punishable under Sections 64(1),64(2)
(i)(m) and 69 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

2. Prosecution case in brief is as follows:- On 22.07.2024 at 10.30 am _ the
accused took the informant to a lodge named “The Lodge” in room no. 303,
Chalai ward, Thycaud village when she became unconscious, after consuming
a sweet given by the accused, committed rape upon her. Thereby the accused
is alleged to have committed the offences punishable under Sections

2
64(1),64(2)(i)(m) and 69 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

3. On appearance of the accused, the copies of all relevant prosecution records
were furnished to the accused and requirements under section 207 of the
Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 are complied with. The accused is on bail
and is directed to appear before the Hon’ble Sessions Court as and when
required.

4, On perusal of records, it is seen the the offences alleged against the accused is
exclusively triable by Hon’ble Sessions Court and the case against him is to
be committed to Hon’ble Sessions Court for trial as provided under section
209 (a) of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

5. The case records shall be forwarded to Honourable Sessions Court. The
properties, if any produced shall be sent subject to Rule 77(2) of Criminal
Rules of Practice, Kerala.

6. Notify the Public Prosecutor of the commitment of the case to the Court of
Sessions under section 209(d) of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

7. The office is directed to keep certified copies of all relevant records before
sending to the Honourable Court of Sessions.

(Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected and
pronounced by me, in open court, on this the 06" day of March,2025).
Judicial Magistrate of First Class — III
Thiruvananthapuram
